triples.name: Large language model
triples.relevance: LLMs are the core technology that the paper integrates into multi-agent systems for software engineering applications.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: Multi-agent systems are the foundational architecture that the paper reviews and analyzes for software engineering tasks.

triples.name: Software engineering
triples.relevance: Software engineering is the primary application domain for LLM-based multi-agent systems that the paper surveys.

triples.name: Autonomous agent
triples.relevance: Autonomous agents are the individual intelligent entities that compose multi-agent systems for problem-solving in software engineering.

triples.name: Systems development life cycle
triples.relevance: The paper maps LMA applications across various stages of the software development lifecycle to demonstrate their applicability.

triples.name: Automated planning and scheduling
triples.relevance: Planning and reasoning capabilities are essential for autonomous agents in multi-agent systems to coordinate and solve complex problems.
